content.main_concept: Nephrotoxic drugs should NOT be combined
content.key_points: - **Drugs that are Nephrotoxic**:\n  - **Aminoglycosides**: (gentamicin, streptomycin, neomycin)\n  - **Chemotherapeutic agents**: (cisplatin, doxorubicin, adriamycin)

questions.question_text: A client who is undergoing chemotherapy with cisplatin (Platinol) has the following doctor's orders. Which one should the nurse question?
options: 2. Arrange for BUN and creatinine tests before therapy.
questions.rationale: **RATIONALE**\n\nCisplatin (Platinol), an antineoplastic agent, and gentamicin (Garamycin), an aminoglycoside antibiotic, are both nephrotoxic drugs and will further impair renal function if given in combination.

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete concept extracted from right side of PDF page 62
extraction_metadata.reference: Karch, Amy, Lippincott's Nursing Drug Guide Philadelphia, Lippincott Williams and Wilkins
